subject: Problems with JUnit + Ant + TestCase
msgSnippet: I m trying to run a whole suite of JUnits at once using ant test . The problem is that some (but not all) of the test output XML files are completely empty.

I'm trying to run a whole suite of JUnits at once using "ant test". 
The problem is that some (but not all) of the test output XML files 
are completely empty. I've seen this problem discussed in this group 
before, but I think my problem is different:

I'm using a class in some places that extends TestCase and does some 
database setup work. The JUnits that extend MyTestCase are the ones 
that don't show up; the ones that extend it directly, do.

I can only assume that I've somehow incorrectly overriden TestCase, 
but I'm not sure how or what the fix would be...
